channel.title: Something I dont understand
channel.description:
Well in the General Programming section all of my games I have been creating keep being deleted just because they are made using GML. But under the topic it says:
General Programming A place to discuss programming, [b]regardless of language choice[/b], that isn't related to private server development.
If its regardless of choice, why are they deleted?

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:6, topic:386595”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_Maker_Language
“scripting language”

en.wikipedia.org

List of programming languages

The aim of this list of programming languages is to include all notable programming languages in existence, both those in current use and historical ones, in alphabetical order, except for dialects of BASIC, esoteric programming languages, and markup languages.


it isnt listed here…

i cant really say anything though i havent used it, and hardly know anything about it.[/quote]

And yes it is listed there. Click on the “G” at the top and it will say “Game Maker Language” in the programming languages section

[quote=“Davidi2, post:16, topic:386595”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=482364.msg3532592#msg3532592 date=1300301965]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=482364.msg3532588#msg3532588 date=1300301780]

You should all stop qqing over something so small and let the poor guy post his games. Its not hurting anything…
[/quote]It hurts my feelings

Then don’t open the threads posted by him, or block him.
[/quote]lol To be honest I don’t really care if he posts the games or not. It’s just that a mod told him not to, and the fact he completely ignored that annoyed me.[/quote]

Davidi2 I do realize that I did this and I am sorry.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:10, topic:386595”][quote author=ranger squad link=topic=482364.msg3532565#msg3532565 date=1300299692]
Davidi, I have experimented with Game Maker and the things he post have clearly required a lot of scripting than something RPG Maker would require.
[/quote]Then perhaps they are not his, he was churning out one every day or two.

Either way, a mod said stop, and he didn’t. And it’s clearly a scripting language, which isn’t allowed.[/quote]
I have plenty of games I created on my USB.

ranger squad:

Davidi, I have experimented with Game Maker and the things he post have clearly required a lot of scripting than something RPG Maker would require.

Thank you

NOTE The only work that game maker actually does for you is organize. It keeps everything seperated and it allowes you to give the object the proper sprite/background/sound instead of haveing to code that yourself. Otherwise everything is up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

General Discussion it is ;))))

Though I think the point Fat Cookies was trying to make was that this GMLProgrammer guy came here to learn Java, and he should do so

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

As for the whole scripting language argument, things like Ruby, Python and Lua are generally considered as scripting languages but would still be acceptable in this section. Also, the other argument about it doing the work for you is a poor one. A higher level application written in Java with its graphics APIs is really doing a lot of the lower-level work for you as well.

Anyway, if the games the OP has been making aren’t suitable for the programming section I’m sure he would/should still be allowed to post them in general discussion since that contains everything else that doesn’t break the rules, and I’m certain that using something like Game Maker isn’t against the overall forum rules.

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

[quote=“ranger squad, post:9, topic:386595”]Davidi, I have experimented with Game Maker and the things he post have clearly required a lot of scripting than something RPG Maker would require.[/quote]Then perhaps they are not his, he was churning out one every day or two.

Either way, a mod said stop, and he didn’t. And it’s clearly a scripting language, which isn’t allowed.

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It’s a scripting language, interpreted by an engine that does all of the hard work for you.

We should strain that this board is only for "proper" (c,c++,c#,java etc etc) programming languages therefore applications made with the aid of another application and scripts is not programming. For example, a game written in java using a pre-made engine is acceptable while making a game with rpg maker isn't.

Feel free to make a game engine and then post it, but a mod specifically told you in your first topic to stop posting the games, and you kept going.

You said you came here to learn some Java, why not start now?

[quote=“Newty, post:7, topic:386595”]I honestly don’t see the problem in him posting it here. It’s clear that he is pretty fluent in this language so who are we to stop him?[/quote]None of us can judge how fluent he is in the language, as (most) of us haven’t seen anything in this scripting language besides what he’s posted. The sticky clearly states things like this aren’t allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

GameMaker Studio

GameMaker Studio (formerly Animo until 1999, Game Maker until 2011, GameMaker until 2012, and GameMaker: Studio until 2017) is a cross-platform game engine developed by YoYo Games. GameMaker accommodates the creation of cross-platform and multi-genre video games using a custom drag-and-drop visual programming language or a scripting language known as Game Maker Language, which can be used to develop more advanced games that could not be created just by using the drag and drop features. GameMaker ...


“scripting language”

en.wikipedia.org

List of programming languages

The aim of this list of programming languages is to include all notable programming languages in existence, both those in current use and historical ones, in alphabetical order, except for dialects of BASIC, esoteric programming languages, and markup languages.


it isnt listed here…

i cant really say anything though i havent used it, and hardly know anything about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

GML Programmer:

Yes there are scripts in GML, but GML has fully transformed since people used them back at the age of “8”. I went to DeVry University and that is where I first learned about GML and yes it is in fact now classified as a programming language. There is nothing you cant do in GML that you can do in any other language. GML is actually considered a sub-programming language of C/XML.

This is not DeVry’s site though, is it?

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

GML Programmer:

Yes there are scripts in GML, but GML has fully transformed since people used them back at the age of “8”. I went to DeVry University and that is where I first learned about GML and yes it is in fact now classified as a programming language. There is nothing you cant do in GML that you can do in any other language. GML is actually considered a sub-programming language of C/XML.

But in the opinion of moparscape staff its still scripting, accept it and be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Something I dont understand
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Its in the stickies, the exception to being allowed is scriping, or not using your own code (a game engine thats not your is allowed). Sure, gact GML is giving you the engine is fine, but issue is, its scripting, not programmig.

Read full topic
